column2: Danesgrammy, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Norflex for almost 30 years for muscles spasms in my neck/back due to degeneration of my cervical spine.  Norflex helps keep it under control so that I have been able to avoid surgery for many years.

column2: Sally, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Took it for severe back spasms.  I was able to tolerate it and function accordingly, but the muscle twitching has been disrupting.  All over muscle twitching, that I never had; prior to the start of the medication.  Took the medicine for 5-6 days.  No longer taking it.  I hope the twitching resolves soon!

column2: Wallace, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Have been using Norflex for over 12 months. Just started having blurred vision 3 months ago. I had trouble passing the state license exam, even with glasses.  It seems to be getting worse.  RPH, said contact DR.  DR. wants me to go off of it, and see what happens.Hope it works, will give it at least 2 months.

column9: I HAVE NEUROPATHY AND THIS IS THE BEST MUSCLE RELAXER I HAVE EVER TAKEN,,AND IVE HAD IT FOR 12 YEARS NOW. GUESS IT DONT HURT TO SOMETHING NEW..

column2: 65-74 Male  (Patient)
column9: I have a genetic disorder in my lower back often causing pain there and in my left leg and ankle when I over exert myself.  I take this at night and sleep restfully and wake up without any stiffness.  I usually only need to take this once a day for just two or three days and then I go about my business.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: Justlettinuno, 19-24 Female  (Patient)

column2: justice, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: it helps with the muscles in my back and legs

column2: Painerella, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Being a person who suffers from multiple, chronic mild to severe pain problems, many meds. have been prescribed to me.  In conjunction w/pain meds., Flexeril has been prescribed and works VERY WELL, however, while years ago it used to not make me tired, it now does. Norflex works wonderfully and does not make me tired!!  As with each individual (and all medications), results will vary.  Unfortunately, we have to be guinea pigs to find out what works, what doesn't and what's going to send us into side effect land.  Norflex works great for me!  Good luck to anyone and everyone who has to take medication and i hope you feel better.

column2: Wiblet, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was taking for severe muscle stiffness and pain in back and neck.  By the 3rd day I started feeling very confused.  By the 5th day, I had severe tremors and muscle twitching all over my body.  I could not stay still..my heart was racing and even trying to relax my legs and arms would literally jump.  After trip to ER I was told this was a side effect and even after only taking it for less than a week, it could take up to 3-4 weeks for the side effects to go away.  I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.  But there are other posts on here where it has worked for other people.  Every one obviously reacts differently.  But it was a very scary side effect and I usually can handle taking meds with out any major side effects.

column2: nicole, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: okay

column2: bitchiecupcake, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I take this medication for the pain and stiffness and sometimes muscle faciculations due to fibromyalgia.  It seems gentler than other relaxants i've used.. no problems with it.  I also have muscle tightness/burning, where i have disk problems in my neck and it appears to help with that also. No side effects except i have had burning pain in my stomach for a few weeks, which may or may not be related.

column2: dcunningham, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
Magnolia, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Norflex for two weeks.My jaw has been locking and causing great pain. The first day of taking this  made the pain level go very low. I don't seem to have any sideaffects. Thanks you.

column2: onehappycoustomer, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: I, A 22 y/o Male Had pulled my stabilizer muscles in my lower back, lifting one of my patients into bed.. the pain was unbearable.. i was givin Ultracet and Norflex.. The two worked wonders it allowed me to take when i was working, didn't make me feel tired or sleepy, and  i was in no pain in bed..After doing the same thing on the same person and hurting the same part of my back, i was given norflex again allong with Percocet 10/660 and the two again worked well with one another, i would reccomend norflex rto anyone , especially to active people like myself,  a Nurse...--M.M

column2: whoshecoo254, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: it make me sleepy...i have been on it for 4 days.

column2: slm623, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have a constant spasm in my lower right back, my pcp has prescribed this for me after it was given to me in the emergency room.  I have been doing physical therapy along with it and it allows my back to loosen up so I can do the exercises.

column2: Tikiman100, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After Back Surgery (1 1/2 Years ago) I started developing a really bad muscle spasm (Charlie Horse) in my lower back. I've been through the Facet Injections, Trigger Point injections and continued to be in pain.While I DID fall asleep at nights, I never felt like I actually got into that deep sleep, so I was always exhausted when I woke up.The first evening I took this drug (NORFLEX) I actually felt like I was able to sleep, and I wasn't tired.Then the next morning (12 Hrs since last dose) I took my second pill. I was able to efficiently complete all my tasks that day with NO signs of being tired or dizzy.I hate taking ANY medication, and especially medications that make you tired. I was really happy to find this muscle relaxer.Good Luck!"Finally out of pain, in Florida"

column2: Faithful, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've only been on this drug for 1 wk.  Already experience improved movement & less pain.  I suffer with cervical herniated discs.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Goes to work quickly releaving muscle spasms in my back. Does not make me drowsy.

column2: badgirl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Norflex for a month now for night time pain associated with Fibromyalgia,and osteoarthritis,it doen'st help at all.At first it did,but now all it does is make my acid reflux worse,and I am suppose to take 100 mg 4 times a day.The only thing good i can say is yes it makes me sleepy,but doesnt not help the pain at all,because i take it 4 times a day all i do is sleep.I have treid several pain pills and muscle relaxers,and nothing works,if you dont have to do not take this drug,its very ineffective at releiveing pain,it just makes you fell stoned all the time,and very unblalabced,and dizzy..

column2: thumper2005, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Norflex for a month now for muscle spasms relating to a slipped disc in my back.  It is working well for me. I was taking flexaril and felt like a zombie all the time I was awake. I slept more than I was awake with the flexaril. With the norflex I am awake and can function normally. I have no side effects with this drug.  I have also noticed a difference in my joint pain. I have no cartalidge in my knees. I was having a lot of pain in them. With the norflex  I find I am a lot more mobile than before. I wish I had been given this drug a long time ago.

column2: JR, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My doctor prescribed Norflex for extreme, nightly leg cramps when Zanaflex became ineffective after 2 years.  I take 1 100mg dose at bedtime & have had zero side effects & NO MORE cramps!  I also have fibromyalgia and have had no flareups.

column2: jsellman, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just started this medication 5 days ago to help treat my migraines (2x daily). Almost immediately I noticed that my vision without my reading glasses is worse and I have some balance issues when I get up from my desk for the first few hours after taking it. I will give it another week, but if it doesn't work, I'll have to go back to Flexaril or something else.

column2: grisell, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column9: I've had chronic neck pain / strain for two months.  Exercise and heat wraps did nothing.  Orphenadrine eased the pain literally after the first pill!  I have not experienced any side-effects whatsoever.

column2: EAO, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It took me a few days to get over the "drunken" effect, but after that, I could function.  Very happy overall.

column2: lionstar, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Robaxin for years and its effectiveness is starting to wear off. My doctor switched me to this medication and I found that it was a great substitute for Robaxin. Now my doctor and I have two drugs that I can use to fight my chronic bad back.  He is switching me to Norflex and in three months will switch me back to Robaxin.

column2: bob tangert, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

Norflex is not quite helping either but I just started taking and 1 positive side effect is I take 2 100mg before bed and it makes me sleep better.
